data.title: The Remains of the Day: Literature & Film

data.text:
A Newberry Library Adult Education Class. Thursdays 2:00 – 4:00pm, Sept. 5 – Sept. 26 (via Zoom). Registration information here.

“It has been my privilege to see the best of England over the years, sir, within these very walls.”

This class will offer a three-part reading of Kazuo Ishiguro’s masterpiece of emotional and historical memory, The Remains of the Day, followed by a discussion of the heartbreakingly beautiful 1993 film adaptation directed by James Ivory. Together, the novel and film offer a timely meditation on lost opportunities—personal, political, and moral.
